IntersightPolicies.description: Pools are the basic building blocks for uniquely identifying hardware resources. As the basis for the UCS management model, they allow Service Profiles to be associated with any blade server, while still providing the exact same ID and presentation to the upstream LAN or SAN. If a pool is actively associated with a profile, the pool cannot be deleted.

adapter_configuration.description:
An Adapter Configuration Policy configures the Ethernet and Fibre-Channel settings for the Virtual Interface Card (VIC) adapter..
Required Attributes:
  * add_vic_adapter_configuration
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * tags
adapter_configuration.title:
adapter_configuration - Adapter Configuration
Intersight Uri: adapter/ConfigPolicies

bios.description:
A BIOS policy automates the configuration of BIOS settings on servers. You can create one or more BIOS policies that contain a specific grouping of BIOS settings, matching the needs of a server or a set of servers. If you do not specify a BIOS policy for a server, the BIOS settings will default to set of values for a brand new baremetal server or to a set of values previously configured using Cisco IMC. If a BIOS policy is specified, its values replace any previously configured values on the server.
All BIOS tokens are not applicable to all servers. If unsupported tokens are pushed to a server, those tokens are ignored.
Required Attributes:
  * name

Recommended Attribute: bios_template

bios.title:
bios - Bios
Intersight Uri: bios/Policies

boot_order.description:
The Boot Order policy configures the linear ordering of devices and enables you to change the boot order and boot mode. You can also add multiple devices under various device types, rearrange the boot order, and set parameters for each boot device type.
Required Attributes:
  * boot_devices
  * enable_secure_boot
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * boot_mode
  * description
  * tags
boot_order.title:
boot_order - Boot Order
Intersight Uri: boot/PrecisionPolicies

certificate_management.description:
Allows you to specify the certificate and private key-pair details for an external certificate.
Note: Currently, Cisco Intersight supports Certificate Management of IMC Certificates only.
Required Attributes:
  * assigned_sensitive_data
  * certificate
  * name
  * private_key

Optional Attributes:
  * enabled
  * description
  * tags
certificate_management.title:
certificate_management - Certificate Management
Intersight Uri: certificatemanagement/Policies

device_connector.description:
Device Connector Policy lets you choose the Configuration from Intersight only option to control configuration changes allowed from Cisco IMC. The Configuration from Intersight only option is enabled by default. You will observe the following changes when you deploy the Device Connector policy in Intersight:
  * Validation tasks will fail:
    * If Intersight Read-only mode is enabled in the claimed device.
    * If the firmware version of the Cisco UCS Standalone C-Series Servers is lower than 4.0(1).
  * If Intersight Read-only mode is enabled, firmware upgrades will be successful only when performed from Intersight. Firmware upgrade performed locally from Cisco IMC will fail.
  * IPMI over LAN privileges will be reset to read-only level if Configuration from Intersight only is enabled through the Device Connector policy, or if the same configuration is enabled in the Device Connector in Cisco IMC.
Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * configuration_lockout
  * description
  * tags
device_connector.title:
device_connector - Device Connector
Intersight Uri: deviceconnector/Policies

drive_security.description:
In Intersight Managed Mode, the Drive Security Policy allows you to specify the KMIP server details and attach the policy to the server profile.
Required Attributes:
  * assigned_sensitive_data
  * name
  * primary_kmip_server

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * secondary_kmip_server
  * tags
  * username
drive_security.title:
drive_security - Drive Security
Intersight Uri: storage/DriveSecurityPolicies

ethernet_adapter.description:
An Ethernet adapter policy governs the host-side behavior of the adapter, including how the adapter handles traffic. For each VIC Virtual Ethernet Interface, you can configure various features like Virtual Extensible LAN (VXLAN), Network Virtualization using Generic Routing Encapsulation (NVGRE), Accelerated Receive Flow Steering (ARFS), Interrupt settings, and TCP Offload settings.
The Ethernet Adapter policy include the recommended settings for the virtual Ethernet interface, for each supported server operating system. Operating systems are sensitive to the settings in these policies. In general, the storage vendors require non-default adapter settings. You can find the details of these required settings on the support list provided by those vendors.
IMPORTANT NOTE: If GENEVE Offload is Enabled be sure to Read the Following Guidance: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/Intersight/b_Intersight_Managed_Mode_Configuration_Guide/b_intersight_managed_mode_guide_chapter_0110.html#reference_ofm_khm_5jb
Required Attributes:
  * name

Recommended Attribute: adapter_template

Optional Attributes:
  * completion
  * description
  * enable_accelerated_receive_flow_steering
  * enable_advanced_filter
  * enable_geneve_offload
  * enable_interrupt_scaling
  * enable_nvgre_offload
  * enable_vxlan_offload
  * interrupt_settings
  * receive
  * receive_side_scaling
  * roce_settings
  * tags
  * tcp_offload
  * transmit
  * uplink_failback_timeout
ethernet_adapter.title:
ethernet_adapter - Ethernet Adapter
Intersight Uri: vnic/EthAdapterPolicies

ethernet_network.description:
An Ethernet Network policy determines if the port can carry single VLAN (Access) or multiple VLANs (Trunk) traffic. You can specify the VLAN to be associated with an Ethernet packet if no tag is found.
Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * default_vlan
  * description
  * tags
  * vlan_mode
ethernet_network.title:
ethernet_network - Ethernet Network
Intersight Uri: vnic/EthNetworkPolicies

ethernet_network_control.description:
Ethernet Network Control policies configure the network control settings for the UCS Domain. This policy is applicable only for the Appliance Ports defined in a Port Policy and for the vNICs defined in a LAN Connectivity Policy, on an FI-Attached UCS Servers.
Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * action_on_uplink_fail
  * cdp_enable
  * description
  * lldp_enable_receive
  * lldp_enable_transmit
  * mac_register_mode
  * mac_security_forge
  * tags
ethernet_network_control.title:
ethernet_network_control - Ethernet Network Control
Intersight Uri: fabric/EthNetworkControlPolicies

ethernet_network_group.description:
Ethernet Network Group policies configure the Allowed VLANs and Native VLAN settings for the UCS Domain.
Required Attributes:
  * allowed_vlans
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * native_vlan
ethernet_network_group.title:
ethernet_network_group - Ethernet Network Group
Intersight Uri: fabric/EthNetworkGroupPolicies

ethernet_qos.description:
An Ethernet Quality of Service (QoS) policy assigns a system class to the outgoing traffic for a vNIC. This system class determines the quality of service for the outgoing traffic. For certain adapters, you can also specify additional controls like burst and rate on the outgoing traffic.
Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * burst
  * cos
  * description
  * enable_trust_host_cos
  * mtu
  * priority
  * rate_limit
  * tags
ethernet_qos.title:
ethernet_qos - Ethernet Qos
Intersight Uri: vnic/EthQosPolicies

fc_zone.description:
This policy allows you to set up access control between hosts and storage devices.
  * Certain points to be noted when creating the FC Zone policy:
  * Deploying a storage VSAN using a domain profile, for the first time, clears all the unmanaged zones from the Fabric Interconnect.
  * SAN boot targets with a storage VSAN have a zone entry in the Fabric Interconnect.
  * A one-time SAN boot with a storage VSAN has a zone entry in the Fabric Interconnect.
  * Editing the FC Zone policy causes the server profile status to be changed to Pending Changes.
  * When the Fabric Interconnect is rebooted, there is a replay of zones in the configuration.
  * Detection of configuration drift is not supported for FC Zone policy.
Required Attributes:
  * fc_target_members
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * fc_target_zoning_type
  * tags
fc_zone.title:
fc_zone - Fc Zone
Intersight Uri: fabric/FcZonePolicies

fibre_channel_adapter.description:
A Fibre Channel adapter policy governs the host-side behavior of the adapter, including how the adapter handles traffic. You can enable FCP Error Recovery, change the default settings of Queues, and Interrupt handling for performance enhancement.
Note: We recommend that you use the values in these policies for the applicable operating system. Do not modify any of the values in the default policies unless directed to do so by Cisco Technical Support.
Required Attributes:
  * name

Recommended Attribute: adapter_template

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * error_detection_timeout
  * error_recovery
  * flogi
  * interrupt
  * io_throttle_count
  * lun
  * plogi
  * receive
  * resource_allocation_timeout
  * scsi_io
  * tags
  * transmit
fibre_channel_adapter.title:
fibre_channel_adapter - Fibre Channel Adapter
Intersight Uri: vnic/FcAdapterPolicies

fibre_channel_network.description:
A Fibre Channel Network policy governs the Virtual Storage Area Network (VSAN) configuration for the virtual interfaces.
Required Attributes:
  * name
  * vsan_id

Optional Attributes:
  * default_vlan_id
  * description
  * tags
fibre_channel_network.title:
fibre_channel_network - Fibre Channel Network
Intersight Uri: fabric/FcNetworkPolicies

fibre_channel_qos.description:
The Fibre Channel QoS policy assigns a system class to the outgoing traffic for a vHBA. This system class determines the quality of service for the outgoing traffic. For certain adapters, you can also specify additional controls like burst and rate on the outgoing traffic.
Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * burst
  * cos
  * description
  * max_data_field_size
  * rate_limit
  * tags
fibre_channel_qos.title:
fibre_channel_qos - Fibre Channel Qos
Intersight Uri: vnic/FcQosPolicies

firmware.description:
This policy allows you to see the firmware present in your systems, as against the firmware baseline. Firmware policy also enables you to bring the firmware of your systems in line with the desired version and thereby enables the drive to compliance.
Required Attributes:
  * models
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * advanced_mode
  * description
  * tags
  * target_platform
firmware.title:
firmware - Firmware
Intersight Uri: firmware/Policies

flow_control.description:
Configure the Priority Flow Control for each port, to enable the no-drop behavior for the CoS defined by the System QoS Policy and an Ethernet QoS policy. In Auto and On priorities, the Receive and Send link level flow control will be Off.
Required Attributes:

Intersight Uri: vnic/IscsiAdapterPolicies

iscsi_boot.description:
iSCSI boot support allows you to initialize the Operating System on FI-attached blade and rack servers from a remote disk across a Storage Area Network. The remote disk, known as the target, is accessed using TCP/IP and iSCSI boot firmware.
Prerequisites - The following are required to configure the iSCSI boot device:
  * iSCSI Static Target Policy—When you select Static as the mode for configuring the iSCSI boot policy, you can use the iSCSI Static Target policy to specify the primary target details. You can also specify the details of a secondary target, if required.
  * iSCSI Adapter Policy—Using this policy you can specify the TCP and DHCP Connection Timeout and the retry count when the logical unit number of the boot device is busy.
  * Creating an IQN Pool—Using this policy you can specify the TCP and DHCP Connection Timeout and the retry count when the logical unit number of the boot device is busy.
Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * authentication
  * description
  * dhcp_vendor_id_iqn
  * initiator_ip_source
  * initiator_static_ipv4_config
  * tags
  * target_source_type
iscsi_boot.title:
iscsi_boot - Iscsi Boot
Intersight Uri: vnic/IscsiBootPolicies

iscsi_static_target.description:
The iSCSI Static Target policy allows you to specify the name, IP address, port, and logical unit number of the primary target for iSCSI boot. You can optionally specify these details for a secondary target as well.
Required Attributes:
  * ip_address
  * name
  * target_name

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * lun_id
  * port
  * tags
iscsi_static_target.title:

Intersight Uri: vnic.IscsiStaticTargetPolicies

vlan.description:
VLAN policies create a connection to a specific external LAN. The VLAN isolates traffic to that external LAN, including broadcast traffic. You can create VLANs and Private VLANs using the VLAN policy.
Note: Ensure that each VLAN is associated with a multicast policy. You can edit the existing VLANs and associate them to a multicast policy. You cannot associate a Multicast policy to a Private VLAN.
Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * tags
  * vlans
vlan.title:
vlan - Vlan
Intersight Uri: fabric.EthNetworkPolicies

vsan.description:
With the Virtual SAN Identifier (VSAN) policy, you can create Virtual SANs (VSANs) to isolate devices physically connected to the same SAN fabric. VSANs improve security and stability in Fibre Channel fabrics and let you create several logical SANs over a common physical infrastructure.
Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * tags
  * uplink_trunking
  * vsans
vsan.title:
vsan - Vsan
Intersight Uri: fabric.FcNetworkPolicies

enable_fip.description: Default is true.  If Selected, then FCoE Initialization Protocol (FIP) mode is enabled. FIP mode ensures that the adapter is compatible with current FCoE standards.
enable_fip.title: enable_fip

enable_lldp.description: Default is true.  If Selected, then Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP) enables all the Data Center Bridging Capability Exchange protocol (DCBX) functionality, which includes FCoE, priority based flow control.
enable_lldp.title: enable_lldp

enable_port_channel.description:
Default is true.  When Port Channel is enabled, two vNICs and two vHBAs are available for use on the adapter card.
When disabled, four vNICs and four vHBAs are available for use on the adapter card. Disabling port channel reboots the server.
Port Channel is supported only for Cisco VIC 1455/1457 adapters.
enable_port_channel.title: enable_port_channel

pci_slot.description: Default is 'MLOM'.  PCIe slot where the VIC adapter is installed. Supported values are (1-15) and MLOM.
pci_slot.title: pci_slot

adapter.DceInterfaceSettings.description: Settings applicable for the Data Center Ethernet (DCE) interfaces on the adapter card.

items.description:
Default is 'cl91'.  Forward Error Correction (FEC) mode setting for the DCE interfaces of the adapter. FEC mode setting is supported only for Cisco VIC 14xx adapters. FEC mode 'cl74' is unsupported for Cisco VIC 1495/1497. This setting will be ignored for unsupported adapters and for unavailable DCE interfaces.
* `cl74` - Use cl74 standard as FEC mode setting. 'Clause 74' aka FC-FEC ('FireCode' FEC) offers simple, low-latency protection against 1 burst/sparse bit error, but it is not good for random errors.
* `cl91` - Use cl91 standard as FEC mode setting. 'Clause 91' aka RS-FEC ('ReedSolomon' FEC) offers better error protection against bursty and random errors but adds latency.
* `Off` - Disable FEC mode on the DCE Interface.
items.title: dce_interface_fec_mode

dce_interface_fec_modes.title:
dce_interface_fec_modes - Dce Interface Fec Modes
Intersight Uri: adapter/DceInterfaceSettings

adapter.DceInterfaceSettings.title: dce_interface_settings

boot.Bootloader.description: Details of the bootloader to be used.

description.description: Carries more information about the bootloader.  Optional for Uefi.
description.title: description

name.description: Name of the bootloader image.  Optional for Uefi.
name.title: name

path.description: Path to the bootloader image.  Optional for Uefi, used by boot.Iscsi, boot.LocalDisk, boot.Nvme, boot.PchStorage, boot.San, boot.SdCard
path.title: path

boot.Bootloader.title: bootloader - Boot Loader Parameters

boot.PrecisionPolicy.description: Boot order policy models a reusable boot order configuration that can be applied to multiple servers via profile association. It supports advanced boot order configuration on Cisco CIMC servers.

boot_devices.description: List of Boot Devices and their Attributes to Assign to the Boot Policy.
boot_devices.title:
boot_devices - Boot Devices
Intersight Uri: boot/DeviceBases

boot_mode.description:
Sets the BIOS boot mode. UEFI uses the GUID Partition Table (GPT) whereas Legacy mode uses the Master Boot Record (MBR) partitioning scheme. To apply this setting, Please reboot the server.
  * Legacy - Legacy mode refers to the traditional process of booting from BIOS. Legacy mode uses the Master Boot Record (MBR) to locate the bootloader.
  * Uefi - UEFI mode uses the GUID Partition Table (GPT) to locate EFI Service Partitions to boot from.
boot_mode.title: boot_mode

enable_secure_boot.description: If UEFI secure boot is enabled, the boot mode is set to UEFI by default. Secure boot enforces that device boots using only software that is trusted by the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM).
enable_secure_boot.title: enable_secure_boot

assigning meta-data tags to any object.
Required Attributes:
  * key
  * value
tags.title: tags - Tags

boot.PrecisionPolicy.title:
boot_order - Boot Order
Intersight Uri: boot/PrecisionPolicies

boot.DeviceBase.description: Lists properties that are common to all device types. It serves as base class for other device types.

enabled.description: Default is Flag to Enable or Disable the Policy.
enabled.title: enabled

interface_name.description: The name of the underlying virtual ethernet interface used by the PXE or SAN boot device.
interface_name.title: interface_name

lun.description: Default is Required Attribute.  The LUN parameters associated with an iSCSI target. This complex property has following sub-properties:
lun.title: lun

name.description: A name that helps identify a boot device. It can be any string that adheres to the following constraints. It should start and end with an alphanumeric character. It can have underscores and hyphens. It cannot be more than 30 characters.
name.title: name

object_type.description:
The Boot Order Type to Assign to the Boot Device.  Allowed Values are:
  * boot.Iscsi
  * boot.LocalCdd
  * boot.LocalDisk
  * boot.Nvme
  * boot.PchStorage
  * boot.Pxe
  * boot.San
  * boot.SdCard
  * boot.UefiShell
  * boot.Usb
  * boot.VirtualMedia
object_type.title: object_type

port.description: boot.Iscsi can be 0-255.  boot.Pxe is the Port ID of the adapter and values can be between -1 (not defined) and 255.
port.title: port

slot.description: Options for boot.Iscsi, boot.Pxe and boot.San are 1-255, MLOM, L1, L2.  boot.Iscsi and boot.Pxe also support L and OCP.  For boot.LocalDisk values can be 1-205, FMEZZ1-SAS, HBA, M, MRAID, MRAID1, MRAID2, MSTOR-RAID, SAS, RAID.
slot.title: slot

sub_type.description:
The subtype for the selected device type.
The Following Boot Order Types utilize the Subtype Attribute:
boot.SdCard - Below are the Supported Subtype Values:
  * None - No sub type for SD card boot device.
  * flex-util - Use of FlexUtil (microSD) card as sub type for SD card boot device.
  * flex-flash - Use of FlexFlash (SD) card as sub type for SD card boot device.
  * SDCARD - Use of SD card as sub type for the SD Card boot device.
boot.Usb - Below are the Supported Subtype Values:
  * None - No sub type for USB boot device.
  * usb-cd - Use of Compact Disk (CD) as sub-type for the USB boot device.
  * usb-fdd - Use of Floppy Disk Drive (FDD) as sub-type for the USB boot device.
  * usb-hdd - Use of Hard Disk Drive (HDD) as sub-type for the USB boot device.
boot.VirtualMedia - Below are the Supported Subtype Values:
  * None - No sub type for virtual media.
  * cimc-mapped-dvd - The virtual media device is mapped to a virtual DVD device.
  * cimc-mapped-hdd - The virtual media device is mapped to a virtual HDD device.
  * kvm-mapped-dvd - A KVM mapped DVD virtual media device.
  * kvm-mapped-hdd - A KVM mapped HDD virtual media device.
  * kvm-mapped-fdd - A KVM mapped FDD virtual media device.
sub_type.title: sub_type

cos.description:
Class of service Assigned to the System QoS Class.
  * Best Effort - By default is 255 and cannot be changed.
  * Bronze - By default is 1.
  * FC - By default is 3 and cannot be changed.
  * Gold - By default is 4.
  * Platinum - By default is 5.
  * Silver - By default is 2.
cos.title: cos

packet_drop.description: The weight of the QoS Class controls the distribution of bandwidth between QoS Classes, with the same priority after the Guarantees for the QoS Classes are reached.
packet_drop.title: packet_drop

priority.description:
Name of the priority class.  You must configure all the following classes:
  1. Best Effort
  2. Bronze
  3. FC
  4. Gold
  5. Platinum
  6. Silver
priority.title: priority

state.description:
Administrative state for the QoS class.
  * Disabled - Admin configured Disabled State.
  * Enabled - Admin configured Enabled State.
Note: 'Best Effort' and 'FC' Classes are 'Enabled' and cannot be 'Disabled'.
state.title: state

weight.description:
The weight of the QoS Class controls the distribution of bandwidth between QoS Classes,with the same priority after the Guarantees for the QoS Classes are reached.  Default is 1.
  * Best Effort - By Default is 5.
  * Bronze - By Default is 7.
  * FC - By Default is 5.
  * Gold - By Default is 9.
  * Platinum - By Default is 10.
  * Silver - By Default is 8.
weight.title: weight

fabric.SwitchControlPolicy.description: A policy to configure the Switching Mode, Port VLAN Optimization, MAC Aging Time, Reserved VLAN Range of the FI.

ethernet_switching_mode.description:
Enable or Disable Ethernet End Host Switching Mode.
  * end-host - In end-host mode, the fabric interconnects appear to the upstream devices as end hosts with multiple links.  In this mode, the switch does not run Spanning Tree Protocol and avoids loops by following a set of rules for traffic forwarding.  In case of ethernet switching mode - Ethernet end-host mode is also known as Ethernet host virtualizer.
  * switch - In switch mode, the switch runs Spanning Tree Protocol to avoid loops, and broadcast and multicast packets are handled in the traditional way.This is the traditional switch mode.
ethernet_switching_mode.title: ethernet_switching_mode

fc_switching_mode.description:
Enable or Disable FC End Host Switching Mode.
  * end-host - In end-host mode, the fabric interconnects appear to the upstream devices as end hosts with multiple links.  In this mode, the switch does not run Spanning Tree Protocol and avoids loops by following a set of rules for traffic forwarding.  In case of ethernet switching mode - Ethernet end-host mode is also known as Ethernet host virtualizer.
  * switch - In switch mode, the switch runs Spanning Tree Protocol to avoid loops, and broadcast and multicast packets are handled in the traditional way.This is the traditional switch mode.
fc_switching_mode.title: fc_switching_mode

mac_address_table_aging.description:
This specifies one of the option to configure the MAC address aging time.
  * Custom - This option allows the the user to configure the MAC address aging time on the switch. For Switch Model UCS-FI-6454 or higher, the valid range is 120 to 918000 seconds and the switch will set the lower multiple of 5 of the given time.
  * Default - (Default) This option sets the default MAC address aging time to 14500 seconds for End Host mode.
  * Never - This option disables the MAC address aging process and never allows the MAC address entries to get removed from the table.
mac_address_table_aging.title: mac_address_table_aging

mac_aging_time.description: Define the MAC address aging time in seconds.  Range is between 120 to 918000, in multiples of 5, when mac_aging_option is set to Custom.
mac_aging_time.title: mac_aging_time

reserved_vlan_start_id.description: Configures the time between UDLD probe messages on ports that are in advertisement mode and arecurrently determined to be bidirectional.  Valid values are from 7 to 90 seconds.  Default is 15.
reserved_vlan_start_id.title: reserved_vlan_start_id

udld_message_interval.description: Configures the time between UDLD probe messages on ports that are in advertisement mode and arecurrently determined to be bidirectional.  Valid values are from 7 to 90 seconds.  Default is 15.
udld_message_interval.title: udld_message_interval

udld_recovery_action.description:
UDLD recovery when enabled, attempts to bring an UDLD error-disabled port out of reset.
  * none - (Default) No action is taken when a port has been disabled.
  * reset - The switch will attempt to bring a UDLD error-disabled port back online.
udld_recovery_action.title: udld_recovery_action

vlan_port_count_optimization.description: To enable or disable the VLAN port count optimization.  Default is false.
vlan_port_count_optimization.title: vlan_port_count_optimization

bind_method.description:
Default is LoginCredentials.  Authentication method to access LDAP servers.
* `LoginCredentials` - Requires the user credentials. If the bind process fails, then user is denied access.
* `Anonymous` - Requires no username and password. If this option is selected and the LDAP server is configured for Anonymous logins, then the user gains access.
* `ConfiguredCredentials` - Requires a known set of credentials to be specified for the initial bind process. If the initial bind process succeeds, then the distinguished name (DN) of the user name is queried and re-used for the re-binding process. If the re-binding process fails, then the user is denied access.'

iam.EndPointPasswordProperties.description: Set password properties for endpoint users.

always_send_user_password.description: Default is If the option is not set to true, user passwords will only be sent to endpoint devices for new users and if a user password is changed for existing users.

enforce_strong_password.description:
Default is Enables a strong password policy. Strong password requirements:
  A. The password must have a minimum of 8 and a maximum of 20 characters.
  B. The password must not contain the User's Name.
  C. The password must contain characters from three of the following four categories.
    1. English uppercase characters (A through Z).
    2. English lowercase characters (a through z).
    3. Base 10 digits (0 through 9).
    4. Non-alphabetic characters (! , @,
enforce_strong_password.title: enforce_strong_password

grace_period.description: Default is Time, in days, after the password is expired that a user can continue to use their expired password.  The allowed grace period is between 0 to 5 days.  With 0 being no grace period.
grace_period.title: grace_period

notification_period.description: Default is Number of days, between 0 to 15 (0 being disabled), that a user is notified to change their password before it expires.
notification_period.title: notification_period

password_expiry_duration.description:
Default is When Password Expiry is Enabled, this sets the duration of time (in days) a password may be valid.  The password expiry duration must be greater than notification period + grace period.  Range is 1-3650.
 Note:  The password_history - Password change history. Specifies the number of previous passwords that are stored and compared to a new password.  Range is 0 to 5.

This policy allows the application of Persistent Memory Goals and creation of Persistent Memory Regions and Namespaces. The encryption of the Persistent Memory Modules can be enabled through this policy by providing a passphrase.

This is only applicable if running in app-direct-non-interleaved mode.  Options are:
  * 'Not Applicable' - (Default) - The socket memory ID is not applicable if app-direct persistent memory type is selected in the goal
  * 2 - The second socket memory ID within a socket in a server.
  * 4 - The fourth socket memory ID within a socket in a server.
  * 6 - The sixth socket memory ID within a socket in a server.
  * 8 - The eighth socket memory ID within a socket in a server.
  * 10 - The tenth socket memory ID within a socket in a server.
  * 12 - The twelfth socket memory ID within a socket in a server.

power.Policy.description: Power Management policy models a configuration that can be applied to Chassis or Server to manage Power Related Features.

dynamic_power_rebalancing.description:
Sets the Dynamic Power Rebalancing of the System. This option is only supported for Cisco UCS X series Chassis.
  * Enabled - Set the value to Enabled.
  * Disabled - Set the value to Disabled.
dynamic_power_rebalancing.title: dynamic_power_rebalancing

power_allocation.description: Sets the Allocated Power Budget of the System (in Watts). This field is only supported for Cisco UCS X series Chassis.
power_allocation.title: power_allocation

power_priority.description:
Sets the Power Priority of the System. This field is only supported for Cisco UCS X series servers.
  * Low - Set the value to Low.
  * Medium - Set the value to Medium.
  * High - Set the value to High.
power_priority.title: power_priority

power_profiling.description:
Sets the Power Profiling of the Server. This field is only supported for Cisco UCS X series servers.
  * Enabled - Set the value to Enabled.
  * Disabled - Set the value to Disabled.
power_profiling.title: power_profiling

power_restore.description:
Sets the Power Restore State of the Server.
  * AlwaysOff - Set the Power Restore Mode to Off.
  * AlwaysOn - Set the Power Restore Mode to On.
  * LastState - Set the Power Restore Mode to LastState.
power_restore.title: power_restore

power_save_mode.description:
Sets the Power Save mode of the System. This option is only supported for Cisco UCS X series Chassis.
  * Enabled - Set the value to Enabled.
  * Disabled - Set the value to Disabled.
power_save_mode.title: power_save_mode

   *  19200 - Value - 19200 for configuring BaudRate token.
   *  38400 - Value - 38400 for configuring BaudRate token.
   *  57600 - Value - 57600 for configuring BaudRate token.
   *  115200 - Value - 115200 for configuring BaudRate token.

smtp.Policy.description: Name that identifies the SMTP Policy.

enable_smtp.description: If enabled, controls the state of the SMTP client service on the managed device.
enable_smtp.title: enable_smtp

mail_alert_recipients.description: List of Emails to send alerts to.

items.description:
Minimum fault severity level to receive email notifications. Email notifications are sent for all faults whose severity is equal to or greater than the chosen level.
  * critical - Minimum severity to report is critical.
  * condition - Minimum severity to report is informational.
  * warning - Minimum severity to report is warning.
  * minor - Minimum severity to report is minor.
  * major - Minimum severity to report is major.
items.title: mail_alert_recipient

mail_alert_recipients.title: mail_alert_recipients - Mail Alert Recipients

minimum_severity.description:
Minimum fault severity level to receive email notifications. Email notifications are sent for all faults whose severity is equal to or greater than the chosen level.
  * critical - Minimum severity to report is critical.
  * condition - Minimum severity to report is informational.
  * warning - Minimum severity to report is warning.
  * minor - Minimum severity to report is minor.
  * major - Minimum severity to report is major.
minimum_severity.title: minimum_severity

smtp_alert_sender_address.description: The email address entered here will be displayed as the from address (mail received from address) of all the SMTP mail alerts that are received. If not configured, the hostname of the server is used in the from address field.
smtp_alert_sender_address.title: smtp_alert_sender_address

smtp_port.description: Port number used by the SMTP server for outgoing SMTP communication.  Valid range is between 1-65535.
smtp_port.title: smtp_port

snmp.Policy.description: Policy to configure SNMP settings on endpoint.

access_community_string.description: Default is 0.  A number Between 1-5 to denote to use one of the variables access_community_string_[1-5].  Any other number means no community string.
access_community_string.title: access_community_string

enable_snmp.description: State of the SNMP Policy on the endpoint. If enabled, the endpoint sends SNMP traps to the designated host.
enable_snmp.title: enable_snmp

snmp_community_access.description:
Controls access to the information in the inventory tables. Applicable only for SNMPv1 and SNMPv2c.
  * Disabled - (Defualt) - Blocks access to the information in the inventory tables.
  * Full - Full access to read the information in the inventory tables.
  * Limited - Partial access to read the information in the inventory tables.
snmp_community_access.title: snmp_community_access

snmp_engine_input_id.description: Unique string to identify the device for administration purpose. This is generated from the SNMP Input Engine ID if it is already defined, else it is derived from the BMC serial number.
snmp_engine_input_id.title: snmp_engine_input_id

snmp_port.description: Port on which Cisco IMC SNMP agent runs. Enter a value between 1-65535. Reserved ports not allowed (22, 23, 80, 123, 389, 443, 623, 636, 2068, 3268, 3269).  Default is 161.
snmp_port.title: snmp_port

snmp_trap_destinations.description: List of SNMP Trap Destinations to Assign to the Policy.
snmp_trap_destinations.title:
snmp_trap_destinations - Snmp Trap Destinations
Intersight Uri: snmp/Traps

snmp_users.description: List of SNMP Users to Assign to the SNMP Policy.
snmp_users.title:
snmp_users - Snmp Users
Intersight Uri: snmp/Users

system_contact.description: Contact person responsible for the SNMP implementation. Enter a string up to 64 characters, such as an email address or a name and telephone number.
system_contact.title: system_contact

system_location.description: Location of the host on which the SNMP agent (server) runs.
system_location.title: system_location

tags.description:
An arbitrary key and value pair that can be used to tag REST resources and organize managed objects by
assigning meta-data tags to any object.
Required Attributes:
  * key
  * value
tags.title: tags - Tags

trap_community_string.description: Default is 0.  A number Between 1-5 to denote to use one of the variables trap_community_string_[1-5].  Any other number means no community string.
trap_community_string.title: trap_community_string

snmp.Policy.title:
snmp - SNMP
Intersight Uri: snmp/Policies

snmp.Trap.description: Destination Servers for trap message sent from an agent to the manager.

community_string.description: Default is 0.  A number Between 1-5 to denote to use one of the variables snmp_auth_password_[1-5].  Any other number means no community string.
community_string.title: community_string

enable.description: Default is Enables DNS to access LDAP servers.
enable.title: enable

port.description: Default is Required Attribute.  The port associated with the iSCSI target.
port.title: port

trap_type.description:
Type of trap which decides whether to receive a notification when a trap is received at the destination.
  * Inform - Receive notifications when trap is sent to the destination. This option is valid only for SNMPv2.
  * Trap - Do not receive notifications when trap is sent to the destination.
trap_type.title: trap_type

user.description: SNMP user for the trap. Applicable only to SNMPv3.
user.title: user

snmp.Trap.title: snmp_remote_destinations - SNMP Trap Servers.

snmp.User.description: User based security model, for communication between an agent and manager. Applicable only for SNMPv3.

auth_password.description: Default is 0.  A number Between 1-5 to denote to use one of the variables snmp_auth_password_[1-5].  Any other number means no authentication password.
auth_password.title: auth_password

auth_type.description:
Authorization protocol for authenticating the user.  Currently Options are:
  * MD5
  * SHA (Default)
Note: In the future these options will be added.
  * NA - Authentication protocol is not applicable.
  * SHA-224 - SHA-224 protocol is used to authenticate SNMP user.
  * SHA-256 - SHA-256 protocol is used to authenticate SNMP user.
  * SHA-384 - SHA-384 protocol is used to authenticate SNMP user.
  * SHA-512 - SHA-512 protocol is used to authenticate SNMP user.
auth_type.title: auth_type

name.description:
Authorization protocol for authenticating the user.  Currently Options are:
  * MD5
  * SHA (Default)
Note: In the future these options will be added.
  * NA - Authentication protocol is not applicable.
  * SHA-224 - SHA-224 protocol is used to authenticate SNMP user.
  * SHA-256 - SHA-256 protocol is used to authenticate SNMP user.
  * SHA-384 - SHA-384 protocol is used to authenticate SNMP user.
  * SHA-512 - SHA-512 protocol is used to authenticate SNMP user.
name.title: name

privacy_password.description: Default is 0.  A number Between 1-5 to denote to use one of the variables snmp_privacy_password_[1-5].  Any other number means no Privacy password.
privacy_password.title: privacy_password

privacy_type.description:
Privacy protocol for the user.
  * AES - AES privacy protocol is used for SNMP user.
  * DES - DES privacy protocol is used for SNMP user.
  * NA - Privacy protocol is not applicable.
privacy_type.title: privacy_type

security_level.description:
Security mechanism used for communication between agent and manager.
  * AuthNoPriv - The user requires an authorization password but not a privacy password.
  * AuthPriv (Default) - The user requires both an authorization password and a privacy password.
  * NoAuthNoPriv - The user does not require an authorization or privacy password.
security_level.title: security_level

snmp.User.title: users - SNMP V3 Users

storage.AutomaticDriveGroup.description: Pool represents a collection of IPv4 and/or IPv6 addresses that can be allocated to other configuration entities like server profiles.

drives_per_span.description: Number of drives within this span group. The minimum number of disks needed in a span group varies based on RAID level. RAID0 requires at least one disk. RAID1 and RAID10 requires at least 2 and in multiples of . RAID5 and RAID50 require at least 3 disks in a span group. RAID6 and RAID60 require atleast 4 disks in a span.
drives_per_span.title: drives_per_span

drive_type.description:
Type of drive that should be used for this RAID group.
  * Any - Any type of drive can be used for virtual drive creation.
  * HDD - Hard disk drives should be used for virtual drive creation.
  * SSD - Solid state drives should be used for virtual drive creation.
drive_type.title: drive_type

minimum_drive_size.description: Minimum size of the drive to be used for creating this RAID group.
minimum_drive_size.title: minimum_drive_size

num_dedicated_hot_spares.description: Number of dedicated hot spare disks for this RAID group. Allowed value is a comma or hyphen separated number range.
num_dedicated_hot_spares.title: num_dedicated_hot_spares

number_of_spans.description: Number of span groups to be created for this RAID group. Non-nested RAID levels have a single span.
number_of_spans.title: number_of_spans

use_remaining_drives.description: This flag enables the drive group to use all the remaining drives on the server.
use_remaining_drives.title: use_remaining_drives

storage.AutomaticDriveGroup.title: AutomaticDriveGroups

storage.DriveGroup.description: A reusable RAID drive group configuration that specifies a pool of drives and a set of virtual drives that are to be created using this pool of drives.

name.description: (string) A collection of drives to be used as hot spares for this Drive Group.
name.title: name

raid_level.description: (string) A collection of drives to be used as hot spares for this Drive Group.
raid_level.title: raid_level

virtual_drives.description:
The list of virtual drives and the disk groups that need to be created through this policy.
Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * boot_drive
  * expand_to_available
  * size
  * virtual_drive_policy
virtual_drives.title: virtual_drives - Virtual Drives

storage.DriveGroup.title:
drive_group - Drive Group
Intersight Uri: storage/DriveGroups

storage.M2VirtualDriveConfig.description: This models the options for creating a virtual drive on M.2 RAID controller.

slot.description: The set of drive slots where RAID0 virtual drives must be created.
slot.title: drive_slots

storage.M2VirtualDriveConfig.title: m2_raid_configuration - Virtual Drive Configuration for M.2 RAID controller.

storage.ManualDriveGroup.description:
This drive group is created by specifying the drive slots to be used.
Required Attributes:
  * drive_array_spans

Optional Attributes:
  * dedicated_hot_spares

dedicated_hot_spares.description: (string) A collection of drives to be used as hot spares for this Drive Group.
dedicated_hot_spares.title: dedicated_hot_spares

drive_array_spans.description:
Enter list of Disk IDs separated by comma or hypen. Sample format is 1, 3 or 4-6, 8. Non spanned RAID levels like RAID0, RAID1, RAID5 and RAID6 expect a single group of disks whereas spanned RAID levels need multiple groups of disks with each group representing a span group. Non spanned RAID levels expect one span group and spanned RAID levels accept minimum 2 span groups and up to 8.
Required Attributes:
  * slots
drive_array_spans.title:
drive_array_spans - Drive Array Spans
Intersight Uri: storage/SpanDrives

storage.ManualDriveGroup.title:
manual_drive_group - Manual Drive Group
Intersight Uri: storage/ManualDriveGroup

storage.R0Drive.description: This models a Single Drive RAID Configuration for creation of on RAID0 virtual drive per physical drive and occupying the full disk space on the same.

drive_slots.description: The set of drive slots where RAID0 virtual drives must be created.
drive_slots.title: drive_slots

storage.R0Drive.title: single_drive_raid0_configuration - Single Drive Raid0 Configuration.

storage.SpanDrives.description: This models a single span group of disks in a RAID group.

slots.description:
(string) Collection of local disks that are part of this span group. Allowed value is a comma or hyphen separated number range. The minimum number of disks needed in a span group varies based on RAID level.
  * RAID0 requires at least one disk,
  * RAID1 and RAID10 requires at least 2 and in multiples of 2,
  * RAID5 RAID50 RAID6 and RAID60 require at least 3 disks in a span group.
  * Enable - Enables IO caching on the drive.
  * NoChange - Drive cache policy is unchanged.
slots.title: slots

storage.SpanDrives.title: drive_array_spans - Single Span Group of disks in a Raid Group.

storage.StoragePolicy.description: The storage policy models the reusable storage related configuration that can be applied on many servers. This policy allows creation of RAID groups using existing disk group policies and virtual drives on the drive groups. The user has options to move all unused disks to JBOD or Unconfigured good state. The encryption of drives can be enabled through this policy using remote keys from a KMIP server.

global_hot_spares.description: A collection of disks that is to be used as hot spares, globally, for all the RAID groups. Allowed value is a number range separated by a comma or a hyphen.
global_hot_spares.title: global_hot_spares

tags.description:
An arbitrary key and value pair that can be used to tag REST resources and organize managed objects by
assigning meta-data tags to any object.
Required Attributes:
  * key
  * value
tags.title: tags - Tags

unused_disks_state.description:
State to which disks, not used in this policy, are to be moved.
  * NoChange - (Default) Drive state will not be modified by Storage Policy.
  * UnconfiguredGood - Unconfigured good state -ready to be added in a RAID group.
  * Jbod - JBOD state where the disks start showing up to Host OS.
unused_disks_state.title: unused_disks_state

use_jbod_for_vd_creation.description: Default is false.  Disks in JBOD State are used to create virtual drives.
use_jbod_for_vd_creation.title: use_jbod_for_vd_creation

storage.StoragePolicy.title:
storage - Storage
Intersight Uri: storage/StoragePolicies

storage.VirtualDriveConfiguration.description: Definition of the list of properties defined in 'storage.VirtualDriveConfiguration', excluding properties defined in parent classes.

boot_drive.description: (bool) This flag enables this virtual drive to be used as a boot drive.
boot_drive.title: boot_drive

expand_to_available.description: (bool) This flag enables the virtual drive to use all the space available in the disk group. When this flag is enabled, the size property is ignored.
expand_to_available.title: expand_to_available

name.description: (string) A collection of drives to be used as hot spares for this Drive Group.
name.title: name

size.description: (int) Virtual drive size in MebiBytes. Size is mandatory field except when the Expand to Available option is enabled.
size.title: size

storage.VirtualDriveConfiguration.title: VirtualDrive

storage.VirtualDrivePolicy.description: This models the manual drive selection configuration.

access_policy.description:
(string) Access policy that host has on this virtual drive.
  * Default - Use platform default access mode.
  * ReadWrite - Enables host to perform read-write on the VD.
  * ReadOnly - Host can only read from the VD.
  * Blocked - Host can neither read nor write to the VD.
access_policy.title: access_policy

drive_cache.description:
(string) Disk cache policy for the virtual drive.
  * Default - Use platform default drive cache mode.
  * NoChange - Drive cache policy is unchanged.
  * Enable - Enables IO caching on the drive.
  * Disable - Disables IO caching on the drive.
drive_cache.title: drive_cache

read_policy.description:
(string) Read ahead mode to be used to read data from this virtual drive.
  * Default - Use platform default read ahead mode.
  * ReadAhead - Use read ahead mode for the policy.
  * NoReadAhead - Do not use read ahead mode for the policy.
read_policy.title: read_policy

strip_size.description:
(int) Desired strip size - Allowed values are 64, 128, 256, 512, 1024.
  * 64 - Number of bytes in a strip is 64 Kibibytes.
  * 128 - Number of bytes in a strip is 128 Kibibytes.
  * 256 - Number of bytes in a strip is 256 Kibibytes.
  * 512 - Number of bytes in a strip is 512 Kibibytes.
  * 1024 - Number of bytes in a strip is 1024 Kibibytes or 1 Mebibyte.
strip_size.title: strip_size

write_policy.description:
(string) Write mode to be used to write data to this virtual drive.
  * Default - Use platform default write mode.
  * WriteThrough - Data is written through the cache and to the physical drives. Performance is improved, because subsequent reads of that data can be satisfied from the cache.
  * WriteBackGoodBbu - Data is stored in the cache, and is only written to the physical drives when space in the cache is needed. Virtual drives requesting this policy fall back to Write Through caching when the battery backup unit (BBU) cannot guarantee the safety of the cache in the event of a power failure.
  * AlwaysWriteBack - With this policy, write caching remains Write Back even if the battery backup unit is defective or discharged.
write_policy.title: write_policy

storage.VirtualDrivePolicy.title: virtual_drive_poliy - Storage Virtual Drive Policy.

Minimum fault severity level to receive email notifications. Email notifications are sent for all faults whose severity is equal to or greater than the chosen level.
  * critical - Minimum severity to report is critical.
  * condition - Minimum severity to report is informational.
  * warning - Minimum severity to report is warning.
  * minor - Minimum severity to report is minor.
  * major - Minimum severity to report is major.

thermal.Policy.description: Thermal Management policy models a configuration that can be applied to Chassis or Server to manage Thermal Features.

fan_control_mode.description:
Sets the Fan Control Mode of the System. High Power, Maximum Power and Acoustic modes are only supported for Cisco UCS X series Chassis.
  * Acoustic - The fan speed is reduced to reduce noise levels in acoustic-sensitive environments. This Mode is only supported for UCS X series Chassis.
  * Balanced - The fans run faster when needed based on the heat generated by the chassis. When possible, the fans returns to the minimum required speed.
  * LowPower - The Fans run at the minimum speed required to keep the chassis cool.
  * HighPower - The fans are kept at higher speed to emphasizes performance over power consumption. This Mode is only supported for UCS X series Chassis.
  * MaximumPower - The fans are always kept at maximum speed. This option provides the most cooling and consumes the most power. This Mode is only supported for UCS X series Chassis.
fan_control_mode.title: fan_control_mode

vmedia.Mapping.description: Pool represents a collection of IPv4 and/or IPv6 addresses that can be allocated to other configuration entities like server profiles.

authentication_protocol.description:
Type of Authentication protocol when CIFS is used for communication with the remote server.
  * none - (Default) No authentication is used.
  * ntlm - NT LAN Manager (NTLM) security protocol. Use this option only with Windows 2008 R2 and Windows 2012 R2.
  * ntlmi - NTLMi security protocol. Use this option only when you enable Digital Signing in the CIFS Windows server.
  * ntlmv2 - NTLMv2 security protocol. Use this option only with Samba Linux.
  * ntlmv2i - NTLMv2i security protocol. Use this option only with Samba Linux.
  * ntlmssp - NT LAN Manager Security Support Provider (NTLMSSP) protocol. Use this option only with Windows 2008 R2 and Windows 2012 R2.
  * ntlmsspi - NTLMSSPi protocol. Use this option only when you enable Digital Signing in the CIFS Windows server.
authentication_protocol.title: authentication_protocol

device_type.description:
Type of remote Virtual Media device.
  * cdd - (Default) Uses compact disc drive as the virtual media mount device.
  * hdd - Uses hard disk drive as the virtual media mount device.
device_type.title: device_type

file_location.description:
The remote file location path for the virtual media mapping. Accepted formats are:
  * HDD for CIFS/NFS: hostname-or-IP/filePath/fileName.img
  * CDD for CIFS/NFS: hostname-or-IP/filePath/fileName.iso
  * HDD for HTTP/S: http[s]://hostname-or-IP/filePath/fileName.img
  * CDD for HTTP/S: http[s]://hostname-or-IP/filePath/fileName.iso
file_location.title: file_location

mount_options.description:
Mount options for the Virtual Media mapping. The field can be left blank or filled in a comma separated list with the following options.
For NFS, supported options are:
  * ro
  * rw
  * nolock
  * noexec
  * soft
  * port=VALUE
  * timeo=VALUE
  * retry=VALUE
For CIFS, supported options are:
  * soft
  * nounix
  * noserverino
  * guest
Note: For CIFS version less than 3.0, vers=VALUE is mandatory. e.g. vers=2.0
For HTTP/HTTPS, the only supported option is:
  * noauto
mount_options.title: mount_options

name.description:
Protocol to use to communicate with the remote server.
  * nfs - NFS protocol for vmedia mount.
  * cifs - CIFS protocol for vmedia mount.
  * http - HTTP protocol for vmedia mount.
  * https - HTTPS protocol for vmedia mount.
name.title: protocol

protocol.description:
Protocol to use to communicate with the remote server.
  * nfs - NFS protocol for vmedia mount.
  * cifs - CIFS protocol for vmedia mount.
  * http - HTTP protocol for vmedia mount.
  * https - HTTPS protocol for vmedia mount.
protocol.title: protocol

password.description: If doing CHAP or Mutual Chap authentication set this to 1 and configure the iscsi_boot_password.
password.title: password

vnic.EthAdapterPolicy.description: An Ethernet adapter policy governs the host-side behavior of the adapter, including how the adapter handles traffic. For each VIC Virtual Ethernet Interface various features like VXLAN, NVGRE, ARFS, Interrupt settings, and TCP Offload settings can be configured.

enable_accelerated_receive_flow_steering.description: Settings for Accelerated Receive Flow Steering to reduce the network latency and increase CPU cache efficiency.

enable_advanced_filter.description: Default is false.  Enables advanced filtering on the interface.
enable_advanced_filter.title: enable_advanced_filter

enable_geneve_offload.description: Default is false.  GENEVE offload protocol allows you to create logical networks that span physical network boundaries by allowing any information to be encoded in a packet and passed between tunnel endpoints.
enable_geneve_offload.title: enable_geneve_offload

enable_interrupt_scaling.description: Default is false.  Enables Interrupt Scaling on the interface.

enable_nvgre_offload.description: Default is false.  Status of the Network Virtualization using Generic Routing Encapsulation on the virtual ethernet interface.

enable_vxlan_offload.description: Default is false.  Status of the Virtual Extensible LAN Protocol on the virtual ethernet interface.

receive_side_scaling_enable.description: Default is true.  Receive Side Scaling allows the incoming traffic to be spread across multiple CPU cores.
receive_side_scaling_enable.title: receive_side_scaling_enable

After a vNIC has started using its secondary interface, this setting controls how long the primary interface must be available before the system resumes using the primary interface for the vNIC.  Range is 0-600.

It is applicable for Cisco VIC adapters only which are connected to Fabric Interconnect cluster. The uplink if specified determines the primary uplink in case of a failover.

Default is POOL.  Type of allocation selected to assign a MAC address for the vnic.
  * POOL - The user selects a pool from which the mac/wwn address will be leased for the Virtual Interface.
  * STATIC - The user assigns a static mac/wwn address for the Virtual Interface.

mac_addresses_static.description:
A List of Static MAC Addresses to Assign to the vNIC's if the Allocation Type is set to STATIC.  The WWPN address must be in hexadecimal format xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx.
Allowed ranges are 20:00:00:00:00:00:00:00 to 20:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF or from 50:00:00:00:00:00:00:00 to 5F:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF.
To ensure uniqueness of WWN's in the SAN fabric, you are strongly encouraged to use the WWN prefix - 20:00:00:25:B5:xx:xx:xx.

items.description:
The MAC address must be in hexadecimal format xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx.
To ensure uniqueness of MACs in the LAN fabric, you are strongly encouraged to use the
following MAC prefix 00:25:B5:xx:xx:xx.

vnic.EthInterruptSettings.description: Placement Settings for the virtual interface.

coalescing_type.description:
Default is MIN.  Interrupt Coalescing Type. This can be one of the following:- MIN - The system waits for the time specified in the Coalescing Time field before sending another interrupt event IDLE - The system does not send an interrupt until there is a period of no activity lasting as least as long as the time specified in the Coalescing Time field.  Options are:
  * IDLE
  * MIN
coalescing_type.title: coalescing_type

mode.description:
Default is MSIx.  The preferred driver interrupt mode. This can be one of the following:
  * INTx - Line-based interrupt (INTx) mechanism similar to the one used in Legacy systems.
  * MSI - Message Signaled Interrupt (MSI) mechanism that treats messages as interrupts.
  * MSIx - Message Signaled Interrupt mechanism with the optional extension (MSIx).
mode.title: mode

timer.description: Default is 125.  The time to wait between interrupts or the idle period that must be encountered before an interrupt is sent. To turn off interrupt coalescing, enter 0 (zero) in this field.  Range is 0-65535.
timer.title: timer

interrupts.description: Default is 8.  The number of interrupt resources to allocate. Typical value is be equal to the number of completion queue resources.  Range is 1-1024.
interrupts.title: interrupts

vnic.EthInterruptSettings.title:
interrupt_settings - Interrupt Settings
Intersight Uri: vnic/EthInterruptSettings

vnic.EthNetworkPolicy.description: An Ethernet Network policy determines if the port can carry single VLAN (Access) or multiple VLANs (Trunk) traffic. You can specify the VLAN to be associated with an Ethernet packet if no tag is found.

default_vlan.description: Default is 0.  Native VLAN ID of the virtual interface or the corresponding vethernet on the peer Fabric Interconnect to which the virtual interface is connected. Setting the ID to 0 will not associate any native VLAN to the traffic on the virtual interface.
default_vlan.title: default_vlan

vlan_mode.description:
Default is ACCESS.  Option to determine if the port can carry single VLAN (Access) or multiple VLANs (Trunk) traffic.
  * ACCESS - An access port carries traffic only for a single VLAN on the interface.
  * TRUNK - A trunk port can have two or more VLANs configured on the interface. It can carry traffic for several VLANs simultaneously.
vlan_mode.title: vlan_mode

Intersight Uri: vnic/EthNetworkPolicies

vnic.EthQosPolicy.description: An Ethernet Quality of Service (QoS) policy assigns a system class to the outgoing traffic for a vNIC. This system class determines the quality of service for the outgoing traffic. For certain adapters additional controls can be specified like burst and rate on the outgoing traffic.

burst.description: Default is 1024.  The burst traffic, in bytes, allowed on the vNIC.  Value can be between 1024-1000000.
burst.title: burst

cos.description: Default is 0.  Class of Service to be associated to the traffic on the virtual interface.  Value can be between 0-6. For FIAttached this should always be 0.

enable_trust_host_cos.description: Default is false.  Enables usage of the Class of Service provided by the operating system.
enable_trust_host_cos.title: enable_trust_host_cos

mtu.description: Default is 1500.  The Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU) or packet size that the virtual interface accepts.  Value can be between 1500-9000.
mtu.title: mtu

priority.description:
Default is 'Best Effort'.  The priortity matching the System QoS specified in the fabric profile.  Options are:
  * Platinum
  * Gold
  * Silver
  * Bronze
  * Best Effort
  * FC
priority.title: priority

rate_limit.description: Default is 0.  The value in Mbps (0-10G/40G/100G depending on Adapter Model) to use for limiting the data rate on the virtual interface. Setting this to zero will turn rate limiting off.  Range is between 0-100000.
rate_limit.title: rate_limit

vnic.FcAdapterPolicy.description: A Fibre Channel Adapter policy governs the host-side behavior of the adapter, including how the adapter handles traffic. You can enable FCP Error Recovery, change the default settings of Queues and Interrupt handling for performance enhancement.

error_detection_timeout.description: Default is 2000.  Error Detection Timeout, also referred to as EDTOV, is the number of milliseconds to wait before the system assumes that an error has occurred.
error_detection_timeout.title: error_detection_timeout

io_throttle_count.description: Default is 512.  The maximum number of data or control I/O operations that can be pending for the virtual interface at one time. If this value is exceeded, the additional I/O operations wait in the queue until the number of pending I/O operations decreases and the additional operations can be processed.  Range is 1-1024.
io_throttle_count.title: io_throttle_count

lun_queue_depth.description: Default is 20.  The number of commands that the HBA can send and receive in a single transmission per LUN.  Range is 1-254.
lun_queue_depth.title: lun_queue_depth

max_luns_per_target.description: Default is 1024.  The maximum number of LUNs that the Fibre Channel driver will export or show. The maximum number of LUNs is usually controlled by the operating system running on the server.  Rnage is 1-1024.
max_luns_per_target.title: max_luns_per_target

resource_allocation_timeout.description: Default is 10000.  Resource Allocation Timeout, also referred to as RATOV, is the number of milliseconds to wait before the system assumes that a resource cannot be properly allocated.  Range is 5000-100000.
resource_allocation_timeout.title: resource_allocation_timeout

vnic.FcErrorRecoverySettings.description: Placement Settings for the virtual interface.

fcp_error_recovery.description: Default is false.  Enables Fibre Channel Error recovery.
fcp_error_recovery.title: fcp_error_recovery

io_retry_timeout.description: Default is 5.  The number of seconds the adapter waits before aborting the pending command and resending the same IO request. Range is 1-59.
io_retry_timeout.title: io_retry_timeout

link_down_timeout.description: Default is 30000.  The number of milliseconds the port should actually be down before it is marked down and fabric connectivity is lost.  Range is 0-240000.
link_down_timeout.title: link_down_timeout

port_down_io_retry.description: Default is 8.  The number of times an I/O request to a port is retried because the port is busy before the system decides the port is unavailable.  Range is 0-255.

port_down_timeout.description: Default is 10000.  The number of milliseconds a remote Fibre Channel port should be offline before informing the SCSI upper layer that the port is unavailable. vhba_type.description:
VHBA Type configuration for SAN Connectivity Policy. This configuration is supported only on Cisco VIC 14XX series and higher series of adapters.
  * fc-initiator (Default) - The default value set for vHBA Type Configuration. Fc-initiator specifies vHBA as a consumer of storage. Enables SCSI commands to transfer data and status information between host and target storage systems.
  * fc-nvme-initiator - Fc-nvme-initiator specifies vHBA as a consumer of storage. Enables NVMe-based message commands to transfer data and status information between host and target storage systems.
  * fc-nvme-target - Fc-nvme-target specifies vHBA as a provider of storage volumes to initiators. Enables NVMe-based message commands to transfer data and status information between host and target storage systems. Currently tech-preview, only enabled with an asynchronous driver.
  * fc-target - Fc-target specifies vHBA as a provider of storage volumes to initiators. Enables SCSI commands to transfer data and status information between host and target storage systems. fc-target is enabled only with an asynchronous driver.
vhba_type.title: vhba_type

wwpn_allocation_type.description:
Type of allocation selected to assign a WWPN address to the vhba.
  * POOL - The user selects a pool from which the mac/wwn address will be leased for the Virtual Interface.
  * STATIC - The user assigns a static mac/wwn address for the Virtual Interface.
wwpn_allocation_type.title: wwpn_allocation_type

wwpn_pools.description: A List of WWPN Pools to Assign to each of the vHBA's.

wwpn_pools.title:
wwpn_pools - Wwpn Pools
Intersight Uri: fcpool/Pools

wwpn_static_addresses.description:
A List of Static WWPN Addresses to Assign to the vHBA's if the Allocation Type is set to STATIC.  The WWPN address must be in hexadecimal format xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx.
Allowed ranges are 20:00:00:00:00:00:00:00 to 20:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF or from 50:00:00:00:00:00:00:00 to 5F:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF.
To ensure uniqueness of WWN's in the SAN fabric, you are strongly encouraged to use the WWN prefix - 20:00:00:25:B5:xx:xx:xx.

items.description:
The WWPN address must be in hexadecimal format xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx.
Allowed ranges are 20:00:00:00:00:00:00:00 to 20:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF or from 50:00:00:00:00:00:00:00 to 5F:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF.
To ensure uniqueness of WWN's in the SAN fabric, you are strongly encouraged to use the WWN prefix - 20:00:00:25:B5:xx:xx:xx.
items.title: wwpn_address

The maximum value of PCI order is limited by the number of virtual interfaces (Ethernet and Fibre-Channel) on each PCI link on a VIC adapter. number_of_virtual_machine_queues.description: Default is 4.  The number of hardware Virtual Machine Queues to be allocated. The number of VMQs per adapter must be one more than the maximum number of VM NICs.  Range is 1-128.
number_of_virtual_machine_queues.title: number_of_virtual_machine_queues

vmmq_adapter_policy.description: Ethernet Adapter policy to be associated with the VMQ vNICs. The Transmit Queue and Receive Queue resource value of VMMQ adapter policy should be greater than or equal to the configured number of sub vNICs.
vmmq_adapter_policy.title: vmmq_adapter_policy
